body:
Just to get a little bit more in touch with the community and so you guys get to know me better I decided to make an AMA. 

My introduction post -  https://avicus.net/forums/7e4180b6f

Shoot away ❤!

replies.body:
Perseverance and patience makes a great programmer. Always think what you want to archive before getting into the code, imagine the design, the usages, think about what you really want to have and what would be second priority. Then start with the framework, before getting into the details. When you just don't know how to do something and you can't figure it out, Google it and go into w3schools links or stack overflow, they will sure have the best answer. 

Also it's also helpful to talk with someone that knows about it from time to time for better methods to do the same so your code isn't too messy, happens a lot and it's a headache truly.
replies.body_tagged:
Perseverance and patience makes a great programmer. Always think what you want to archive before getting into the code, imagine the design, the usages, think about what you really want to have and what would be second priority. Then start with the framework, before getting into the details. When you just don't know how to do something and you can't figure it out, Google it and go into w3schools links or stack overflow, they will sure have the best answer. 

Also it's also helpful to talk with someone that knows about it from time to time for better methods to do the same so your code isn't too messy, happens a lot and it's a headache truly.

reply_to.body_tagged: Do you use any program while making ur code, or just a notepad? If so, what do you use?

replies.body:
Java: IntelliJ IDEA Community Version

Front-end: I used to use Sublime text, but when I discovered http://atom.io everything from my body disconnected to focus on it. So Atom for that. Also for website stuff the web-page-preview package is very useful to preview:





And yeah, that's atom

replies.body:
1. Hamburger or pizza, don't eat it a lot but I really enjoy when I do.
2. Nestea
3. MC or maybe COD:AW (was quite fun when I played it, and I surprised myself because I was quite good at it!)
4. I never like to answer this question, I feel odd answering it and people get mad afterwards and yell at me.
5. I like playing around with my code and I always have new cool things that could make the page look better, and I don't really feel afraid I will lose the previous version because I can always copy back from older commits.
6. You are a fun guy, you like Rubik's cubes, and you are quite active. You are quite a good friend here too :)
7. Choc...olate morenote

replies.body:
Yup, Ubuntu 14.04 Lts with a mac theme and docky, just for convenience and for beauty's sake, I just like how it looks. 

But yeah I love Linux and pretty enhanced for developing, also way more customizable than Windows (specially arch) 

I also have an Windows 8.1 200gb partition for some video and audio editing software. But my main is linux obviously :]

replies.body:
Yup I have that set up. When I power on the computer and after the bios goes through it prompts me what os I want to boot, I choose and it boots on there. 

Took its time to actually do the whole partition thing, as I couldn't edit the hard drive I was using, and how to use the os without using the hard drive?  Well I ended up running another Ubuntu from USB and editing the hard drive from there.
replies.body_tagged:
Yup I have that set up. When I power on the computer and after the bios goes through it prompts me what os I want to boot, I choose and it boots on there. 

Took its time to actually do the whole partition thing, as I couldn't edit the hard drive I was using, and how to use the os without using the hard drive?  Well I ended up running another Ubuntu from USB and editing the hard drive from there.

replies.body:
Your opinions on Java 8 and Lambda expressions?

Your opinions on Avicus using Java 8 (testing problems, etc.)?

Your opinions on Avicus upgrading to 1.8?
replies.body_tagged:
Your opinions on Java 8 and Lambda expressions?

Your opinions on Avicus using Java 8 (testing problems, etc.)?

Your opinions on Avicus upgrading to 1.8?

replies.body:
"Your opinions on Java 8 and Lambda expressions?"

I have never used Java 8, don't think it'd be much of a hassle either. And... what opinion can I even have on lambda expressions, I mean, is there any controversy or something?

PS: I beg to recall Lambda expressions were something like this,  for(Object o : Collection<Object> as for to iterate through all the collection while being able to reference the current one with o. Am I right?

"Your opinions on Avicus using Java 8 (testing problems, etc.)?"

I don't think it's going to happen.

"Your opinions on Avicus upgrading to 1.8?"

Avicus is sure going to upgrade to 1.8, we just need time to clean up the branch and make it bug-free before we can even push a single commit :/
